msItem.title: I. Sinodos
msItem.rubric: Numbers and incipit of canons; incipit of prayers; incipit of texts; elements of the punctuation signs.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 1ra, l.1: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወልድ፡ ወመልድ[sic]፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ አሐዱ፡ አምላክ። ንቅድም፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ በሠናይ፡ ኅብረት፡ ወበጽሕፈተ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ ዘአብው፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ቅዱሳን፡ ዘሠርዑ፡ ለአርትዖ፡ ቤተ፡ ክርስዲያን፡ ቅድስት። አሕብሮተ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ ዘአበው፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ኅሩያን።Fol. 1ra, l.1 ( Index of the Statutes or Commandments of the Apostles): In the name of the Father, and the Son, and the Holy Spirit, one God. With the help of God, we begin with the good collection, with the writing of of Sinodos of fathers, the Apostles, which they established for the guidance of the holy Church. The gathering of the Sinodos of the fathers, the chosen Apostles.
msItem.explicit: Fol. 182vb, l.25: ኦኤጲስ፡ ቆጶሳት፡ ወከመዝ፡ ሥርዑ፡ ወሐግጉ። ሥርዓተ፡ ንስሐ፡ ከመ፡ ኢይሙት፡ ኀጥእ፡ በኀጢአቱ። ሀብዎሙ፡ ንሥሐ፡ ለእለ፡ ይፈቅዱ፡ ይነስሑ። Fol. 182vb, l. 25 (Penitential Canons Given to St. Peter:): O bishops, prescribe and legislate the order of penance in this way, so that the sinner does not die in his sins. Give penance to those who want (it), let them repent.

list.item: Fol. 40vb, l.30: Acquisition note.Fol. 40vb, l.30: አጥረይክዋ፡ አነ፡ ገበረ፡ መድኅን፡ በመን{ፈ}ሰ፡ ጥበብ፡ [Fol. 40vb, l.30] I acquired it (this book), Gabra Madḫǝn, through the spirit of wisdom. Hand c; cp. also Additiones 2, 4, 8, 10, 12; written over erasure.

Fol. 40vbl. 32: Ownership note.Fol. 40vb, l.32: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ይእቲ፡ አሽር፡ መተራ፡ ደብረ፡ ሎዛ፡ ይወርዱ፡ ባቲ፡ መላእክላት፡ ውስተ፡ ዛቲ፡ መካን፡ የዓውድዋ፡ በክብር፡ ወበስብሐት፡ ማእከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት። [Fol. 40vb, l.32] This book belongs to Däbrä ʿālama ʿAšir Mätära Däbrä Lozza. Through it, the angels come down, to this place, and they go around it with glory and praise. Paradise is in its middle, fire are its margins. Hand d; s. also Additiones nos. 6, 9.

Fol. 58ral.15-17: Short praise for Däbrä ʿālama ʿAšir Mätära.Fol. 58ra, l.15-17: ደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ይእቲ፡ አሽር፡ መተራ፡ ማእከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት። [Fol. 58ra, l.15-17] Däbrä ʿālama, which is ʿAšǝr Mätära, its middle is paradise, its margin is fire. Hand a.

Fol. 68rb, l.28: Exhortation to the priests to read the book of Senodos.Fol. 68rb, l.28: ኦካህናት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ኢትጽርዑ፡ አንብቦ፡ መጸሕፍት። ወአዕርጎ፡ ቊርባን፡ ለሕዝብ፡ በበ፡ ሰናብት። {ዘተሣየጥክዋ፡} ለዛቲ፡ ሲኖዶስ፡ {አነ፡ ካህን፡} በእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለሐዋያት[sic]፡ ወበእንተ፡ ፍቅራ፡ ለማርያም። [Fol. 68rb, l.28] O priests and deacons, do not be idle at reading books, and celebrating the Eucharist for the people on Sabbath-days. I bought this Sinodos, the priest, for the sake of the love of Apostles and for the sake of the love of Mary. Hand a; s. also Additiones 7, 14. The passage is in fact the conclusion of text I-6, but it was turned into an acquisition note a by means of adding ዘተሣየጥክዋ፡ and አነ፡ ካህን፡ (hand c), written over a few erased words.

Fol. 77va, l.28: Doxology.Fol. 77va, l.28: ስብሐት፡ ለአብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ። ዘኀ[er.]ሀለይኩ፡ ወዘተመነይኩ፡ ረከብኩ፡ ለቀድሶ፡ ነፍስ፡ ወሥጋ፡ ሕሊና፡ መፍቅድየ። [Fol. 77va, l.28] Glory be to the Father, the Son, and the Holy Spirit. I have obtained what I thought of and what I desired, for sanctifying of soul and body; intelligence is what I need... Hand c; s. also Additiones 1, 2, 3, 8, 10, 12.

Fol. 87ra, l.12: Admonition concerning the canon regulations on the main church feasts and Baptism.Fol. 87ra, l.12: ወኀልቈ፡ በዓላቲሁስ፡ ለእግዚእነ፡ ዐበይት፡ በዓላት፡ ፱ቱ፡ ጽንሰቱ፡ ልደቱ፡ ግዝረቱ፡ ጥምቀቱ፡ ስቅለቱ፡ ትንሣኤሁ፡ እርገቱ፡ በዐለ፡ ጰራቅሊጦስ፡ ደብረ፡ ታቦር፡ ልደተ፡ ሰምዖን፡ ከግዝረት፡ እሩይ። ጥምቀትስ፡ ሕግ፡ መሲሐዊት፡ ወሕግ፡ መንፈሳዊት፡ ጥምቀትስ፡ ለኵሉ፡ ተሠርዓት፡ ለእደው፡ ወለአንስት፡ ኢይትወከፋ፡ እደው፡ አንስተ፡ ወአንስት፡ አደወ፡ ዘውእቱ፡ አባልጅ፡ ወኢይግበሩ፡ ተዋሰቦ፡ ምስለ፡ ዘተሐበዮ፡ አሁሆሙ፡ ወምስለ፡ ዘተርፋ፡ ነገዱ፡ ለነሳኢ፡ ወለተነሣኢ፡ ውጉዝ፡ በቃለ፡ ፲ወ፩ሐዋርያት። ወአንትሙ፡ ካህናት፡ አጥምቁ፡ አንሰተ፡ በ፹ዕለት፡ ወዕደወ፡ በ፵ዕለት፡ ኢታትርፋ፡ ወኢታሕልፋ። ለእመኮነ፡ ጥምቅት፡ በሰኑይ፡ ኢትብልዑ፡ ቅብዐ፡ እለ፡ ብልዑ፡ ዘይትበላዕ፡ በፆም፡ በዕለተ፡ ቀዳሚት፡ ሰንበት። [Fol. 87ra, l.12] And the number of the feasts of Our Lord is nine great feasts: His Conception, His Birth, His Circumcision, His Baptism, His Crucifixion, His Resurrection, His Ascension, the feast of the Holy Spirit, Däbrä Tabor. The birth of Simon is equivalent to the Circumcision. Baptism is the Christian law, and the spiritual law. Baptism is established for all, for men and women. The women should not accept the men, and the men (should not accept) the women who are ʾabbalǝğ (?). And they should not make marriage with their (god) father who took charge of it, and with the rest of his lineage – neither the one who baptizes, nor the one who is being baptized (?). I t is prohibited by the word of the 12 Apostles. And you, priests, baptize woman on the 80th day and men on the 40th day. Do not leave and do not transgress (this regulation). When it is Baptism, do not eat butter on the second day (Monday) but eat what is eaten on fasting days, on the day of the first Sabbath. Hand e; s. also Additio 13. The term ʾabbalǝğ probably refers to god-children of the same god-father.

Fol. 91vc, l.1: Foundation charter of ʾAsir Mätira.Fol. 91vc, l.1: ዛቲ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ ዘትግሬ፡ መኰንን፡ አከሎም፡ ዘከለላ፡ ወገደማ፡ ወወሀባ፡ ለማርያም፡ አሽር፡ መትራ፡ ይእቲ፡ ደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ወኦዳ፡ በንፍሐተ፡ ቀርን፡ ምስለ፡ ጳጳስ፡ አባ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርዓ፡ ያዕቆብ፡ ለትግሬ፡ መኰንን፡ አከሎም፡ በዘበነ[sic]፡ አባ፡ ይስሐቅ፡ አበ፡ ምኔት። ወበዘበነ[sic]፡ አቡነ፡ አበከረዙነ[sic]። [Fol. 91vc, l.1] This book (is) of tǝgre mäkwännǝn ʾAkkälom who delimited the precinct and established as monastery and donated (the book) to St. Mary of ʾAšǝr Mätǝra, which is Däbrä ʿālama; and he went around with the blowing of the trumpet, together with Bishop (ṗaṗṗas) ʾabba Yoḥannǝs whom our King Zärʾa Yaʿqob gave to tǝgre mäkwännǝn ʾAkkälom, in the time of ʾabba Yǝsḥaq, the abbot, and ʾabunä Abäkäräzun. Hand d; s. also Additiones 2, 9. The note is written in a secondary, later hand 18th or 19th cent. (?).

Fol. 97ra, l.29: Admonition to the priests.Fol. 97ra, l.29: ኦቀሰውሳት፡ ወዲያቆናት፡ ለእመ፡ ኢማሃርክምዎሙ[sic]፡ በበ፡ ሰናብት፡ በዝንቱ፡ ሲኖዶስ። ትወርዱ፡ ውስተ፡ መቅሠፍት። ወኢታጽርዑ፡ መሥዋዕተ፡ በበ፡ ሰናብት። [Fol. 97ra, l.29] O priests and deacons, if you don't teach them each Sabbath day according to this Sinodos, you will descent into the punishment. And you do not be idle at (celebrating) the Mass at Sabbath days! Hand a; s. also Additiones 3, 14.

Fol. 112va, l.24: Supplication of the scribe (?)Fol. 112va, l.24: በእንተ፡ ጸሎቶሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት፡ ወበእንተ፡ ማኅበረ፡ ርቱዓነ፡ ሃይማኖት፡ ወበእንተ፡ ኵሎን፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያናት፡ ይምሐረኒ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ አመ፡ ዕለተ፡ ፍዶ[sic]፡ ወቅስት፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን። [Fol. 112va, l.24] For the sake of the prayer of the Apostles, and for the sake of the assembly of those Righteous of Faith, and for the sake of all Churches, Christ have mercy upon us on the day of repayment (?) and judgement. Amen and amen. Hand c, cp. also Additiones 1, 3, 4, 10, 12. Similar to Addition 4, this note is written over an erased passage of the original text (by hand a), of which only the last two words were retained ("Amen and amen").

Fol. 112va, l.31: A list of the monastery's gwǝlt-possessions.Fol. 112va, l.31: ዛቲ፡ ገዳም፡ መካነ፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እንተ፡ ትሰመይ፡ ደብረ፡ ዓለማ፡ ጉልታ፡ መንበርታ፡ ዴሥአ፡ ሰንአፌ፡ ፯ሀገር፡ ነው። ተዝካር፡ ያወጣ፡ ፊሪዳ። [Fol. 112va, l.31] This monastery is the place of saints which is called Däbrä ʿālama. Its gwǝlt-possessions are (in) Mänbärta, Desʾa (and) Sänʾafe, seven lands. For the commemoration feat, each brings a calf. Hand d; s. also Addition 2, 6; Partly in Amharic.

Fol. 123va, l.26: Supplication.Fol. 123va, l.26: ምሥጢር፡ ኅቡእ፡ ዘተከሥት፡ በቅዱሳን፡ ዘኤንሶን፡ ወዘአናቶን፡ ይምልአኒ፡ ፍርቃን፡ ወኢይርከበኒ፡ ኀዘን፡ ወእስከ፡ ምጽአቱ፡ ለመድኅን፡ አሜን። ለይኵን። መሢሕየ፡ አኤናዎን፡ ያርፍቀኒ፡ ውስተ፡ ምሳሀ፡ ደብረ፡ ጽዮን። አሜን። [Fol: 123va, l.26] The hidden mystery which was revealed by saints [?] and [?], it fill up me with salvation and it does not gives me sadness; and until the arrival of the savior, amen, and of his rule, it [?] me [?] it invite me to the table of Däbrä Ṣǝyon, amen. Hand c; s. also add. nos. 1, 3, 5, 8, 12; Written over erased punctuation sign.

Fol. 140va, l.15: Note concerning fasting times. Fol. 140va, l.15: አንቀጽ፡ በእንተ፡ አጽዋማት። ቀዳሚ፡ ፆመ፡ አምላክ፡ ወዳግመ፡ ፆመ፡ ድሕነት፡ ወአርብ፡ ወጾመ፡ ሐዋርያት፡ ወፆመ፡ ነቢያት፡ ወገሐድ፡ ዘልደት፡ ገሐድ፡ ዘጥምቀት፡ ፆመ፡ ነነዌ፡ ጥምቀት፡ ለእመ፡ ኮነ፡ በሰኑይ፡ በዕለት፡ ቀዳሚት፡ ወዕሁድ፡ ኢትብልዑ፡ ሥጋ፡ ወቅብአ፡ አላ፡ ብልዑ፡ ዘይትበላዕ፡ በዐቢይ፡ ፆም፡ ዘወጽአ፡ እምዝንቱ፡ ሕግ፡ ርጉም፡ ወውጉዝ፡ ውእቱ፡ ይቤሉ፡ ሐዎርያት፡ በሲኖዶሶሙ። [Fol. 140va, l.15] First, fast of God and secondly, fast of the salvation, and fourthly, fast of the Apostles and fast of the Prophets, and on the eve of Nativity and on the eve of Epiphany, fast of Nänäwé, if Epiphany is on the second day of the week, the first day, or Sunday, meat and oil will not be eaten but eat what is it eaten during the great fast which started from this cursed rule and averted, as the Apostles said in their Sinodos. Hand f.
Fol. 140vb, l.11: Unclear note. Fol. 140vb, l.11: አዚዝ፡ መንፈስ፡ እምከቢት፡ ወእስከ፡ ሐዲሰ፡ ወእስከ፡ ትበሊ፡ የብስ፡ ከበደ፡ አበላ፡ ለይደመስስ። Hand c; s. also add. nos. 1, 3, 4, 8, 10; Written over erased punctuation signs.

Fol. 140vb, l.14: Foundation charter of Däbrä ʿālama ʿAšǝr Mätära.Fol. 140vb, l.14: ንጽሕፍ፡ ሥርዓተ፡ አበው፡ ዘአስተናበሩ፡ አበው፡ ቅዱሳን፡ እለ፡ በደብር፡ ወበአታት፡ በዘመነ፡ ንጉሥነ፡ ዘርአ፡ ያዕቆብ። ወበዘመነ፡ ጳጳሳቲነ፡ አባ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ወአባ፡ ገብርኤል፡ እምአመ፡ ተሐድገ፡ መንበረ፡ ነገሥተ፡ አክሱም፡ ተሐደሰ፡ በ፹ወ፯አመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ በዘመነ፡ ማቴዎስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፡ ጕልታ፡ ሠንአፌ፡ ፲ሀገር፡ መንበርታ፡ ዴስአ፡ ነው፡ አስራት፡ በኵራት፡ ቆብ፡ ብይን፡ ተሰካር፡ ዋርሳ፡ በርሰዋ፡ ይታዘዝ፡ ብለው፡ አውግዘዋል። አሺርመትራ፡ ማዕከላ፡ ገነት፡ ዳሯ፡ እሳት፡ ትኩን፡ ብለው፡ ከመ፡ ኢይግብዑ፡ ሰብ፡ በሥልጣነ፡ አብ፡ ወወል [ድ] ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ ተጽሕፈ፡ በዘመነ፡ አቡነ፡ አበከረዙን። [Fol. 140vb, l.14] We copied the ordinances of Fathers set in order by saint Fathers who were in the convent and removed, in the time of our king Zärʾa Yaʿǝqob. And in the time of metropolitans ʾabba Mikāʾel and ʾabba Gäbrǝʾel, since it was abandoned, the throne of kings of Aksum, it was restored, in the 87th year of mercy [1435 A.D.], during the time of Matewos the evangelist [blank line] The gwult is in Sänʾafe, 10 lands, in Mänbärta and Desʾa, the ʾasrat (…) Ašir Mätǝra [blank line] Paradise is in its middle, fire are its margins (...) Hand e; s. also add. no. 5; In red ink; line 10, 16, and partly l. 20 are washed out.

Fol. 166vb, l.27: Scribe's supplication.Fol. 166vb, l.27: ለጸሐፊሃ፡ ስረዩ፡ ወባርኩ፡ ወዘገደፍኩ፡ አርትዑ፡ በቃልክሙ፡ ኦካህናቲሁ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ያብርህ፡ አዕይንተ፡ ልብክሙ። (blank line) ፡ በእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለሐዋርያት። ወበእንተ፡ ፍቅሮሙ፡ ለአርድእት፡ ይጽሐፍ፡ ስሞ፡ ኀበ፡ ዓምደ፡ ወርቅ፡ በሰማያት። [Fol. 166vb, l.27] For your scribe, forgive him and bless him, I rejected what they declared right by their voice, O priests of God, He illumines the eyes of your heart [blank line] thanks to the love of the Apostles and thanks to the love of the assistants, he wrote his name near to the golden column in the skies. Hand a; s. also Additiones 3, 7.

binding.decoNote: Wooden boards (recently) covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Four pairs of sewing stations.
Parchment guards (possibly of the same origin as fol. 183) were used to sew together fols. 1-2.

origin.origDate: Second half of the 15th - mid 16th century (?). Additio 7 refers to the role of King Zärʾa Yaʿqob (r. 1434-68) and Bishop (here called ṗaṗas) Yoḥannǝs in the foundation of the monastery, but it is written in a later hand. The latter arrived to Ethiopia in 1438-39 (bearing the title ʾeṗisqoṗos), together with metropolitans Mikāʾel and Gabrǝʾel (after 1458, there was no bishop in Ethiopia). Cf. S.C. MUNRO-HAY, Ethiopia and Alexandria, vol. 2, Warszawa-Wiesbaden, 2005, pp. 28-36. Additiones 7 and 14 contain references to ʾAbäkäräzun of Gabra Gärzän (ca. 1394-1476).
